liminal 0.0.4.9999
  • Get started
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • pdfsense: or understanding high dimensional parameter space

Rescale all columns of a matrix

clamps.Rd

Rescale all columns of a matrix

clamp(.data)

clamp_robust(.data)

clamp_sd(.data, sd = 1e-04)

Arguments

.data

A numeric matrix
sd

the value of each columns standard devation

Details

These functions are used internally by the tour to rescale all columns of .data.

  • clamp() rescales so all values for each column lie in the unit interval

  • clamp_robust() rescales by first centering by the median and then scaling by MADs

  • clamp_sd() rescales all columns to have a fixed standard deviation.

Examples

mv <- matrix(rnorm(300), ncol = 3)

clamp(mv)
#>              [,1]       [,2]       [,3]
